channel.title: Error connecting issue
channel.description:
I've currently done this:
Port forwarded, I've turned my firewall off and the client has the correct IP, exceptions in my router, what else is there?

item.title: Error connecting issue
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:469807”][quote author=T7S link=topic=587117.msg4166726#msg4166726 date=1353797231]
I could not see your service on (IP HERE) on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out
[/quote]

That means that a remote connection could not connect to you from port 43594 (ie. you haven’t completed the forwarding process).

Change the IP in the client to 127.0.0.1 just to make sure that you can connect fine. If you can, double check that you’ve made exceptions in the windows firewall, whatever antivirus you’re running (if it blocks incoming connections like a firewall), and any routers that the connection must go through.[/quote]

I turned my firewall off, I can connect using 127.0.01, turned off all anti-viruses.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting issue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“T7S, post:3, topic:469807”]I could not see your service on (IP HERE) on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out[/quote]

That means that a remote connection could not connect to you from port 43594 (ie. you haven’t completed the forwarding process).

Change the IP in the client to 127.0.0.1 just to make sure that you can connect fine. If you can, double check that you’ve made exceptions in the windows firewall, whatever antivirus you’re running (if it blocks incoming connections like a firewall), and any routers that the connection must go through.

Read full topic
